required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Chiglitazar Compare With Placebo in Type 2 Diabetes Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Phase III Study of Chiglitazar in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus and Insufficient Glycemic Control Despite Diet and Exercise -- A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind, and Placebo-Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Chiglitazar, compare with placebo.

detailed_description.textblock: The efficacy and safety will be compared between Chiglitazar and placebo after treatment of 24 weeks. The long term efficacy and safety of Chiglitazar will be evaluated after 52 weeks treatment.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Change in HbA1c from baseline after 24 weeks of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in HbA1c from baseline for patients with a baseline HbA1c >=8.5%
Change in HbA1c from baseline in patients with a baseline HbA1c < 8.5%
Percentage of patients that attained target HbA1c <7.0%
Percentage of patients whose HbA1c lowered by at least 0.5%
Change in fasting plasma glucose from baseline
Change in 2-h postprandial glucose (2hPPG) from baseline
Change in total cholesterol (TC) from baseline
Change in high density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C)from baseline
Change in low density proprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) from baseline
Change in free fatty acid (FFA) from baseline
Change in fasting plasma insulin from baseline
Change in blood pressure from baseline
Percentage of patients who use rescue therapy

arm_group.description: Patients administrate Chiglitazar 32mg once daily for 52 weeks
Patients administrate Chiglitazar 48mg once daily for 52 weeks
Patients administrate placebo for 24 weeks.From week 25 to 52, patients are randomly switched to Arm 1 and Arm 2, and receive the treatment accordingly.
